item.title: Dana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it)." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Everything just blows me away." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't pointless things have a place, too, in this far-from-perfect world?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there" -- George Harrison

item.title: Dana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "In a Wonderland they lie, Dreaming as the days go by, Dreaming as the summers die: Ever drifting down the stream- Lingering in the golden gleam- Life, what is it but a dream?" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Tut, tut, child!" said the Duchess. "Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I hate feelings. Why does sobriety have to come with feelings?" -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I know exactly how that is. To love somebody who doesn’t deserve it. Because they are all you have. Because any attention is better than no attention. For exactly the same reason, it is sometimes satisfying to cut yourself and bleed. On those gray days where eight in the morning looks no different from noon and nothing has happened and nothing is going to happen and you are washing a glass in the sink and it breaks-accidentally-and punctures your skin. And then there is this shocking red, the brightest thing in the day, so vibrant it buzzes, this blood of yours. That is okay sometimes because at least you know you’re alive." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I think I love him, but I also think that you can love people who aren't good for you." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "It’s a wonder I’m even alive. Sometimes I think that. I think that I can’t believe I haven’t killed myself. But there’s something in me that just keeps going on. I think it has something to do with tomorrow, that there is always one, and that everything can change when it comes." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "Part of me believes that love is more valuable when you have to work for it." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "Doctor, if being a bitch is healthy, then I am the healthiest damn woman on the face of the earth" -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "Stars should not be seen alone. That's why there are so many. Two people should stand together and look at them. One person alone will surely miss the good ones." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "...I don't think it's any more deceptive than wearing four-inch come-fuck-me pumps when one has no intention of ever fucking anybody." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Dana add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Death is not the opposite of life, but a part of it." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Dana add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours. In all the world, there is no love for you like mine." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Dana add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "What horrifies me most is the idea of being useless: well-educated, brilliantly promising, and fading out into an indifferent middle age." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost; that is where they should be. Now put the foundations under them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Nothing makes the earth seem so spacious as to have friends at a distance; they make the latitudes and longitudes." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "All good things are wild and free." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I have never found a companion that was so companionable as solitude." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dana add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "In writing, you must kill all your darlings." -- William Faulkner
